verses.kjv: Now Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David. And Jehoram his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in David’s city, and Jehoram his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat died and was buried with his ancestors in the city of David. His son Jehoram became king after him.

verses.kjv: And he had brethren the sons of Jehoshaphat, Azariah, and Jehiel, and Zechariah, and Azariah, and Michael, and Shephatiah: all these were the sons of Jehoshaphat king of Israel.
verses.web: He had brothers, the sons of Jehoshaphat: Azariah, Jehiel, Zechariah, Azariah, Michael, and Shephatiah. All these were the sons of Jehoshaphat king of Israel.
verses.ct: Jehoram had several brothers — other sons of Jehoshaphat: Azariah, Jehiel, Zechariah, Azariah, Michael, and Shephatiah. All of them were sons of Jehoshaphat king of Israel.

verses.kjv: And their father gave them great gifts of silver, and of gold, and of precious things, with fenced cities in Judah: but the kingdom gave he to Jehoram; because he was the firstborn.
verses.web: Their father gave them great gifts of silver, of gold, and of precious things, with fortified cities in Judah; but he gave the kingdom to Jehoram, because he was the firstborn.
verses.ct: Their father had given them generous gifts of silver, gold, and other valuable things, along with fortified cities in Judah. But he gave the kingdom to Jehoram, because he was the firstborn.

verses.kjv: Now when Jehoram was risen up to the kingdom of his father, he strengthened himself, and slew all his brethren with the sword, and divers also of the princes of Israel.
verses.web: Now when Jehoram had risen up over the kingdom of his father, and had strengthened himself, he killed all his brothers with the sword, and also some of the princes of Israel.
verses.ct: Once Jehoram had established himself as king over his father's kingdom, he killed all of his brothers with the sword, along with some of the officials of Israel.

verses.kjv: Jehoram was thirty and two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eight years in Jerusalem.
verses.web: Jehoram was thirty-two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eight years in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Jehoram was 32 years old when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 8 years.

verses.kjv: And he walked in the way of the kings of Israel, like as did the house of Ahab: for he had the daughter of Ahab to wife: and he wrought that which was evil in the eyes of the LORD.
verses.web: He walked in the way of the kings of Israel, as did Ahab’s house; for he had Ahab’s daughter as his wife. He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight.
verses.ct: He followed the ways of the kings of Israel, just as the house of Ahab had done — because he had married Ahab's daughter. The LORD saw that he was evil.

verses.kjv: Howbeit the LORD would not destroy the house of David, because of the covenant that he had made with David, and as he promised to give a light to him and to his sons for ever.
verses.web: However LORD would not destroy David’s house, because of the covenant that he had made with David, and as he promised to give a lamp to him and to his children always.
verses.ct: Even so, the LORD refused to destroy the house of David, because of the covenant he had made with David. He had promised to keep a light burning for David and his descendants forever.

verses.kjv: In his days the Edomites revolted from under the dominion of Judah, and made themselves a king.
verses.web: In his days Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah, and made a king over themselves.
verses.ct: During Jehoram's reign, Edom rebelled against Judah's control and set up their own king.

verses.kjv: Then Jehoram went forth with his princes, and all his chariots with him: and he rose up by night, and smote the Edomites which compassed him in, and the captains of the chariots.
verses.web: Then Jehoram went there with his captains and all his chariots with him. He rose up by night and struck the Edomites who surrounded him, along with the captains of the chariots.
verses.ct: Jehoram marched out with his commanders and all his chariots. He launched a night attack and struck the Edomites who had surrounded him, along with their chariot commanders.

verses.kjv: So the Edomites revolted from under the hand of Judah unto this day. The same time also did Libnah revolt from under his hand; because he had forsaken the LORD God of his fathers.
verses.web: So Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah to this day. Then Libnah revolted at the same time from under his hand, because he had forsaken LORD, the God of his fathers.
verses.ct: But Edom has remained free from Judah's control to this day. Around the same time, Libnah also revolted against Jehoram's rule — all because he had abandoned the LORD, the God of his ancestors.

verses.kjv: Moreover he made high places in the mountains of Judah, and caused the inhabitants of Jerusalem to commit fornication, and compelled Judah thereto.
verses.web: Moreover he made high places in the mountains of Judah, and made the inhabitants of Jerusalem play the prostitute, and led Judah astray.
verses.ct: On top of all this, he built pagan worship sites on the hills of Judah, led the people of Jerusalem into spiritual unfaithfulness, and dragged all of Judah down with them.

verses.kjv: And there came a writing to him from Elijah the prophet, saying, Thus saith the LORD God of David thy father, Because thou hast not walked in the ways of Jehoshaphat thy father, nor in the ways of Asa king of Judah,
verses.web: A letter came to him from Elijah the prophet, saying, “LORD, the God of David your father, says, ‘Because you have not walked in the ways of Jehoshaphat your father, nor in the ways of Asa king of Judah,
verses.ct: Then a letter arrived from Elijah the prophet. It said: "This is what the LORD, the God of your ancestor David, says: 'You have not followed the ways of your father Jehoshaphat or the ways of King Asa of Judah.

verses.kjv: But hast walked in the way of the kings of Israel, and hast made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to go a whoring, like to the whoredoms of the house of Ahab, and also hast slain thy brethren of thy father’s house, which were better than thyself:
verses.web: but have walked in the way of the kings of Israel, and have made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to play the prostitute like Ahab’s house did, and also have slain your brothers of your father’s house, who were better than yourself,
verses.ct: Instead, you have followed the ways of the kings of Israel. You have led Judah and the people of Jerusalem into spiritual unfaithfulness, just like the house of Ahab did. And you have murdered your own brothers — your father's sons — who were better men than you.

verses.kjv: Behold, with a great plague will the LORD smite thy people, and thy children, and thy wives, and all thy goods:
verses.web: behold, LORD will strike your people with a great plague, including your children, your wives, and all your possessions;
verses.ct: Because of this, the LORD is going to strike your people, your children, your wives, and everything you own with a devastating plague.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt have great sickness by disease of thy bowels, until thy bowels fall out by reason of the sickness day by day.
verses.web: and you will have great sickness with a disease of your bowels, until your bowels fall out by reason of the sickness, day by day.’ ”
verses.ct: You yourself will suffer from a severe disease of your intestines. It will grow worse day after day until your bowels come out because of the illness.'"

verses.kjv: Moreover the LORD stirred up against Jehoram the spirit of the Philistines, and of the Arabians, that were near the Ethiopians:
verses.web: LORD stirred up against Jehoram the spirit of the Philistines, and of the Arabians who are beside the Ethiopians;
verses.ct: The LORD stirred up hostility against Jehoram from the Philistines and from the Arabs who lived near the Ethiopians.

verses.kjv: And they came up into Judah, and brake into it, and carried away all the substance that was found in the king’s house, and his sons also, and his wives; so that there was never a son left him, save Jehoahaz, the youngest of his sons.
verses.web: and they came up against Judah, broke into it, and carried away all the possessions that were found in the king’s house, including his sons and his wives; so that there was no son left him, except Jehoahaz, the youngest of his sons.
verses.ct: They invaded Judah, broke through its defenses, and carried off everything of value they found in the king's palace — including his sons and his wives. The only son left to him was Jehoahaz, his youngest.

verses.kjv: And after all this the LORD smote him in his bowels with an incurable disease.
verses.web: After all this LORD struck him in his bowels with an incurable disease.
verses.ct: After all of this, the LORD struck Jehoram with an incurable disease of his intestines.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that in process of time, after the end of two years, his bowels fell out by reason of his sickness: so he died of sore diseases. And his people made no burning for him, like the burning of his fathers.
verses.web: In process of time, at the end of two years, his bowels fell out by reason of his sickness, and he died of severe diseases. His people made no burning for him, like the burning of his fathers.
verses.ct: As time went on, after about 2 years, his bowels came out because of the disease, and he died in terrible agony. His people didn't make a ceremonial fire in his honor the way they had done for his ancestors.

verses.kjv: Thirty and two years old was he when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years, and departed without being desired. Howbeit they buried him in the city of David, but not in the sepulchres of the kings.
verses.web: He was thirty-two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years. He departed without being missed; and they buried him in David’s city, but not in the tombs of the kings.
verses.ct: He was 32 years old when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 8 years. He died and no one mourned him. They buried him in the city of David, but not in the royal tombs.
